Breast Cancer.question: Who can get a free mammogram?
answers: Those with symptoms of breast cancer
Those who had a mammogram in the last 12 months
Those who are pregnant or breastfeeding
Breast Cancer.response: Those aged 45-69 can get a free mammogram! Did you know you can still get screened even if you feel well?

Breast Cancer.question: Where can you find a BreastScreen clinic?
Breast Cancer.response: With BreastScreen clinics all across the country, including several mobile clinics throughout the year, there's sure to be one near you!

Breast Cancer.question: How often can you do a free mammogram?
Breast Cancer.response: You can get your free mammogram every 2 years. Did you know you can still get screened even if you feel well?

Breast Cancer.question: Have you faced any of these barriers before?
Breast Cancer.response: There are many support services in place to help you through the process, continue to find out more!

Cervical Cancer.question: Where can you get your cervical screen done?
answers: Your usual doctor/nurse at a GP clinic
Māori, Pacific or women’s community health centres
Usual doctor/nurse or Māori/Pacific/women's community health centre
Cervical Cancer.correctAnswer: Usual doctor/nurse or Māori/Pacific/women's community health centre
Cervical Cancer.response: You can get screened at your usual doctor or nurse or Māori, Pacific, or women's community health centre!

Cervical Cancer.question: Who can get a free cervical test?
answers: Māori and Pacific women aged 25 to 69
Women aged 25 to 69 with a community services card
Women over the age of 30 who have never been screened or not screened within 5 years
Cervical Cancer.response: Did you know you can still get screened even if you feel healthy?

Cervical Cancer.question: Have you faced any of these barriers before?
Cervical Cancer.response: There are many support services in place to help you through the process, continue to find out more!

Bowel Cancer.question: Where can you do your bowel screening test?
Bowel Cancer.response: You can do the bowel screening test at the comfort of your own home, and it is easy to do!

Bowel Cancer.question: Who can get a free bowel screening test kit?
Bowel Cancer.response: Anyone aged 60-74 can get a free test kit. Did you know you can still get screened even if you feel well?

Bowel Cancer.question: How often will you receive your bowel screening test kit?
Bowel Cancer.response: Screening regularly is important as it can look out for very early signs of cancer!

Bowel Cancer.question: Have you faced any of these barriers before?
Bowel Cancer.response: There are many support services in place to help you through the process, continue to find out more!
